Rest and hydration: One of the most effective treatments for a cold is to rest and drink plenty of fluids. This helps the body fight off the virus and avoid dehydration, which can worsen symptoms.

Decongestants: Over-the-counter decongestants can help relieve congestion and pressure in the nose and sinuses. However, it is important to follow the dosage instructions carefully and not use them for more than three days continuously.
Vapor rub: Vapor rubs can help relieve congestion and coughs by providing a cooling sensation on the skin. They contain menthol or camphor, which can decongest the sinuses.
Steam inhalation: Boiling water and inhaling the steam can help relieve congestion and open up the sinuses. Adding herbs like eucalyptus or mint to the water can enhance the effect.

Acupuncture: Acupuncture is a traditional Chinese medicine technique that involves the insertion of needles into specific points on the body to stimulate healing. Some studies suggest that acupuncture can help relieve cold symptoms when used in combination with other treatments.
